column1: Inver Grove Heights is a city in Dakota County
column2: Minnesota
column4: 880 at the 2010 census. The city was formed on March 9
column6: with the merger of the village of Inver Grove and Inver Grove Township.It is one of 186 cities and townships in the seven-county Minneapolis-Saint Paul metropolitan area. Inver Grove Heights is 9 miles (14 km) southeast of Saint Paul; nearby communities are South St. Paul
column11: and Saint Paul Park (the last two across the Mississippi River).

column1: After the signing of the Treaty of Traverse des Sioux in 1851
column2: settlers from Ireland and Germany quickly staked claims in the rolling countryside west of the Mississippi River. Those of Irish descent farmed the eastern part of the community
column3: while Germans cleared the wooded land to the west for their farms. French and English settlers built their homes along the river. The township of Inver Grove Heights was named after the Irish fishing village of Inver and the German town of Grove. Records show that 240 farms
column5: and four school districts were founded by 1880. On March 9
column7: the village of Inver Grove and Inver Grove Township merged to form Inver Grove Heights.Historic sites in Inver Grove Heights include:

column1: Chief Medicine Bottle's Village: formed in 1836
column2: became Pine Bend village and post office

column1: Mendota-Wabasha Road: a military road laid out by John S. Potter in 1853. Rich Valley Road now follows the old military road.
District 7 School: Dakota County's first public school
column2: established in 1854
organized in 1854
site of first log church in 1854; services and church school were in German

column1: Church of St. Patrick's: Catholic church parish established on January 9
Salem Evangelical Church: First congregation in Minnesota of the Evangelical Association of North America was organized here on March 2
Josiah Burwell's House: where Inver Grove Township was first organized in 1858
column2: at Rich Valley Road and 102nd Street

column1: Reuben Freeman House of eight gables: built in 1876 to one-up the House of Seven Gables
Inver Grove Town Hall: first town hall building
column2: built in 1878

column1: Inver Grove Village railway depot: built in 1886
Rock Island Swing Bridge: Built in 1894
column2: the double-decker swing bridge spanned the Mississippi River between Inver Grove Heights and St. Paul Park. Closed to rail traffic in 1980 and to road traffic in 1999
column3: it opened as Swing Bridge park in 2011.

column1: Duke's Restaurant: built in 1906 as Pierkarski's butcher shop; restaurant offered food to railway workers; later became Jersey's Bar

column3: a U.S. Air force B-52D bomber crashed while on a Cold War training mission originating from Loring Air Force Base
column5: Maine. Seven crewmen gave their lives for their country; marker on Broderick near West Loop Court

column1: The Inver Grove Heights Community Schools district or Independent School District 199 operates five schools in the city:

Salem Hills Elementary SchoolThere is one private school for preschool through eighth grade in Inver Grove Heights: Berea Lutheran Church.The western part of the city is served by Independent School District 196
column2: with students attending Dakota Hills Middle School
column5: and Rosemount High School.Inver Grove Heights is also home to Inver Hills Community College.

column1: Inver Grove's municipal government provides for a council of five members
column2: one of whom is the mayor. The city's mayor is George Tourville
column3: who is in his ninth term
column4: having been first elected in 2002 after 21 years of serving on the council.The other council members are:

column2: city government is nonpartisan. Candidates need not be selected or endorsed by political parties
column3: and by state law no such endorsement appears on the ballot. The mayor is elected every two years while council members are elected every four. Terms are staggered with two council members elected one election cycle and the two others two years later. The non-mayoral seats are elected in pairs
column4: giving voters the chance to vote for up to two candidates. If necessary
column5: races are narrowed down during a primary election.As a part of Dakota County
column6: Inver Grove's northern and central precincts (1
column7: 8-10) join with regions northward to form the Second District on the County Commission. It has been represented by former South St. Paul Mayor Kathleen A. Gaylord since 2003. The southern
column9: and far western portions of the city (precincts 2-7) are joined by regions south and west to form the Fourth District of the County Commission
column10: which has been represented by former State Representative and Inver Grove Heights Mayor Joe Atkins since 2017. County commissioners serve four-year terms.Inver Grove Heights is in Minnesota's 2nd congressional district

column1: The city is in the state's 52nd legislative district
column2: represented in the Minnesota Senate by Matt Klein (DFL); and is entirely encompassed by House District 52B
